Constructor Summary
AnnotationView(MapView map)
          Annotation View provides a View that is displayed on the map to show more information about a particular OverlayItem.

The annotation is displayed at a given GeoPoint (set by calling either #setGeoPoint() or providing an OverlayItem when calling showAnnotationView(OverlayItem) that has an associated GeoPoint.

By default, the annotation will display a title and snippet as contained in the given OverlayItem, or a custome title and snippet can be set using setTitle(String) and setSnippet(String).

The annotation can be further customized by passing your own innerView which will be displayed inside the annotation "bubble".

Constructor Detail

AnnotationView

public AnnotationView(MapView map)
Annotation View provides a View that is displayed on the map to show more information about a particular OverlayItem.

The annotation is displayed at a given GeoPoint (set by calling either #setGeoPoint() or providing an OverlayItem when calling showAnnotationView(OverlayItem) that has an associated GeoPoint.

By default, the annotation will display a title and snippet as contained in the given OverlayItem, or a custome title and snippet can be set using setTitle(String) and setSnippet(String).

The annotation can be further customized by passing your own innerView which will be displayed inside the annotation "bubble". You can also customize the look of the bubble itself using setBackgroundColor(int), and setAnimated(boolean), setBubbleRadius(int).

Parameters:
map - the map on which the annotation is to be displayed
Method Detail

showAnnotationView

public void showAnnotationView(OverlayItem item)
Displays the annotation view using the passed item's GeoPoint (from OverlayItem.getPoint()) with the item's title (using OverlayItem.getTitle()) and snippet (using OverlayItem.getSnippet())

Parameters:
item - the item with which to show the annotation

Displays the annotation view at the given geoPoint, honor's the annotation view's animated property

Hides the currently shown annotation

isTryToKeepBubbleOnScreen

public boolean isTryToKeepBubbleOnScreen()
Returns whether the annotation will be offset to the left or right when it's overlayItem is near the edge of the mapView in an attempt to keep the content of the bubble on screen as much as possible
